instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message:
Hi i have a 820-2330 A 15" macbook, it was liquid damaged.  it powers on chimes nice and long but after the apple logo disappears it crashes to your computer needed to restart from an unexpected error. and then just restarts over and over.  any ideas? many  thanks 
Nate

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: Boot in verbose mode and see when it happens.

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: Looks like its an error on the smc but i have yet to fully understand what it all means.

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message:
No Title

Sorry i thought i uploaded it with high res.  not sure what happened, sorry.

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: ok this is full size now. [ATTACH=CONFIG]n7530[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: [ATTACH]7532._xfImport[/ATTACH]  checking to see if this come out full size

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: let me know if you can read the last one. if not i can get a better quality/ size.  I realized i was leaving it at 300 dpi, so it kept shrinking them for 72dpi for web.

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message:
I see nothing worrying there. Is this right before it crashes? 
Have you disconnected all unnecessary stuff and tried different RAM?

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message:
This was during the verbose bootup, i guess im realizing now that i did miss some of the begging of the text as it goes pretty quick once its started.  i should get you that.  After it gives that text it does nothing just sits there.  

I pulled everything including keyboard but it still crashes during apple logo.  i ran ASD EFI and all the hardware was good, it had over temp on the battery but i pulled the battery and it still crashes the same so i ruled that out as a separate issue.  but like always when trying to run ASD OS it crashes during boot up.     i'm tempted to look around under the scope and just start replacing bad looking parts.. your thinking Patience young grass hopper lol

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: Are you using PC8500 RAM? Change C7771 just to be sure too, replace with a regular size cap.

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: yes using pc8500 and tested a couple sticks.  Replaced the c7771 with a regualr size cap and still crashing during boot.

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: Is everything disconnected that is not needed especially the airport?

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: Yes everything is disconnected.  even tried it once with the keyboard unplugged.  Could it be the HHD  cable?  i dont have one for this model in stock but about to order one just to test with.

threads.title: 820-2330-A powers on to apple logo, Crashes to reboot
threads.message: HDD cable is unlikely. I hope you are checking this with a known good OSX booting from USB.
